title: Welcome
content: Welcome! I'm here to help with projects, questions, and planning. What would you like to explore?

title: Good night
content: Good night! Wishing you a restful evening. If you need anything, I'm here when you return.

title: What services do you offer?
content: I offer custom web and mobile development, AI integration, automation, UX design, consulting, and ongoing maintenance.

title: What is your development process?
content: Discovery → Planning → Design → Development → Testing → Launch → Support. Clear milestones and regular updates at each stage.

title: Do you sign NDAs?
content: Yes. I can sign your NDA or provide a standard mutual NDA to protect confidential information before discussions begin.

title: What are your payment terms?
content: Typical terms: 30–40% upfront, milestone-based payments, and final payment upon delivery. Flexible options available for retainers.

title: Do you provide estimates?
content: Yes. After a short discovery call, I provide a scope outline, timeline range, and detailed cost estimate with assumptions.

title: What technologies do you use?
content: Main stack: React, TypeScript, Node.js, Python, PostgreSQL, Tailwind, and cloud-native tooling when required.

title: Do you offer maintenance plans?
content: Yes. Tiered plans include updates, security patches, backups, monitoring, and small enhancements each month.

title: Who owns the code?
content: Upon payment, you own the delivered code and IP. I provide repository access and a clean handover.

title: How do we communicate?
content: We use your preferred tools (email, Slack, Teams) with weekly check-ins, progress demos, and transparent tracking.

title: What is your revision policy?
content: I include revisions within scope during design and development phases. Changes beyond scope are handled as change requests.

title: Can you do an MVP first?
content: Absolutely. We can prioritize core features, launch an MVP fast, and iterate based on real user feedback.

title: How do you handle scalability?
content: I design with horizontal scaling, caching, optimized queries, and observability to support growth without regressions.

title: Can you migrate existing data?
content: Yes. I plan safe migrations with mapping, backups, validation scripts, and staged cutovers to minimize risk.

title: Which CMS do you recommend?
content: Depends on needs. Options include headless (e.g., Strapi), WordPress for content-heavy sites, or custom CMS for special workflows.

title: Do you offer SEO setup?
content: Yes. Technical SEO basics: meta tags, sitemaps, clean URLs, performance improvements, and analytics integration.

title: Is the app accessible?
content: I follow WCAG guidelines, semantic HTML, keyboard navigation, ARIA roles, and color contrast best practices.

title: Do you set performance budgets?
content: Yes. I define target load times, bundle sizes, Core Web Vitals, and monitor regressions with CI checks.

title: Do you integrate analytics?
content: Yes. Privacy-friendly analytics with dashboards for traffic, conversions, funnels, and event tracking.

title: Can we A/B test features?
content: Yes. I can implement experiments with feature flags, cohorts, and statistical evaluation to guide decisions.

title: Do you perform security audits?
content: I review auth flows, input validation, secrets handling, dependencies, and apply best practices with periodic scans.

title: What about privacy compliance?
content: I help with consent flows, data retention, subject requests, and documentation aligned with GDPR principles.

title: Which integrations can you add?
content: Payments, email, CRM, maps, auth providers, search, storage, and custom APIs—based on your stack and goals.

title: How do you manage rate limits?
content: Through caching, backoff strategies, queuing, and observability to prevent timeouts and degraded UX.

title: Do you set up caching?
content: Yes. CDN and application-level caching (HTTP, Redis) to reduce latency and improve reliability.

title: What is your backup policy?
content: Automated backups, tested restores, versioned snapshots, and clear RPO/RTO targets for resilience.

title: Do you monitor apps in production?
content: Yes. I configure logs, metrics, tracing, and alerts so we can react quickly and prevent issues.

title: What is your incident response?
content: Defined severity levels, on-call escalation, comms templates, postmortems, and corrective actions.

title: Do you provide documentation?
content: Yes. Setup guides, architecture notes, API docs, admin manuals, and runbooks are included.

title: Can you train our team?
content: Yes. Workshops, handover sessions, and recorded walkthroughs tailored to your stack and workflows.

title: What’s included in handover?
content: Repo access, environment configs, credentials transfer, deployment docs, and success criteria review.

title: How do you measure success?
content: We define KPIs—time-to-value, conversion, retention, performance—and track them after launch.

title: How do you handle change requests?
content: We document the request, estimate impact, adjust the plan, and confirm timelines and cost before proceeding.

title: How do you manage risks?
content: Identify early, track openly, mitigate with prototypes, phased releases, and frequent feedback loops.
